Summary Compensation, benefits, HR professional with over 15 years of experience boosting corporate performance for FTSE 250 & Fortune 1000 companies including Citigroup, Air Products & Chemicals Inc and QinetiQ. 
 
• Demonstrated ability to deliver superior global Total Rewards systems for all organizational levels, seamlessly transforming programs into insightful performance motivation tools • Expertise in advising executive teams regarding compensation and benefits best practices • Broadbased Compensation Program Design & Implementation • Sales Compensation • Global Remuneration • Executive Compensation • STI & LTI Plan Design • Development of Total Rewards Strategy • HRIS Development • Performance Management

 Experience Ads Quality Rater, Global Market Google July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Los Angeles Report and track the visual quality and content accuracy of Google advertisements. Keyword categorization and consolidation. Mobile website design evaluation and rating. Interpreting a user query, participating in a deliberation process. Examining and analyzing advertising-related data of different kinds (e.g. text, web pages, images) and providing feedback to Google. Working remotely as part of a global team.  
 Ads Quality Rater, UK Market Google March 2012  –  February 2013  (1 year) Los Angeles, USA One year assignment focussed on the UK market, responsibilities include; 
Evaluate the accuracy of Google web advertising 
Communicate effectiveness of web layouts and information online 
Interpret both the content and tone of colloquialisms, regionalisms and other subtleties specific to United Kingdom & the U.S. 
Catch/understand everyday popular culture references, everyday historical and geographical knowledge specific to each country 
Utilize extensive experience (as user/consumer) of the internet and print culture to localize SEM Group HR Reward & Performance Manager QinetiQ October 2007  –  April 2010  (2 years 7 months) Hampshire, United Kingdom QinetiQ is a FTSE250 provider of technology-based services and solutions to the defense, security and related markets.  
 
* Managed corporation’s delivery of the total rewards package, evaluated market trends and prepared cost analysis models for new remuneration initiatives 
 
* Led annual compensation programs – annual market study, base salary and bonus planning process for 6,500 employees, including establishing divisional budgets and award guidelines and controlling budget spend. 
 
* Developed local Incentive programs - design, communication and measurement of local incentive programmes to meet business objectives and local legal requirements. 
 
* Directed LTI & Stock nomination program – quarterly Executive stock nominations and RemCo approvals. Led the design and launch of an all employee Profit Share Scheme linking corporate performance to the award of free QinetiQ shares.  
 
* Benefits – continuously reviewed and modified benefit provision to retain market competitiveness and cost effectiveness. Responsible for both annual Flexible Benefits enrolment and day-to-day voluntary benefits provision.  European Compensation & Benefits Manager Air Products September 2003  –  October 2007  (4 years 2 months) Surrey, United Kingdom Achievements 
Implemented an Employee-Assistance Programme across 17 countries with one single provider in 3 months.  
 
Proposed, designed, and implemented an all-employee Share Incentive Plan, providing UK employees the opportunity to purchase Air Products shares through a tax-efficient trust. At the time less than 300 schemes had gained Inland Revenue approval and Air Products was among the first with stock quoted on the New York Stock Exchange. Sole responsibility for the extensive management co-ordination needed to drive project from conception through to completion in less than 10 months. As a result of highly visible and creative communication strategy, take-up rates far exceeded expectations.  
 
Developed and executed 5 year strategic plan to improve European base salary competitiveness during period of tight business and economic conditions. Involved extensive market analysis of country and business results, close partnering with country HR and Business Managers, as well as influencing and negotiation skills when presenting to European President and Chief Financial Officer. Compensation and Benefits Analyst Air Products May 1999  –  September 2003  (4 years 5 months) United Kingdom Compiled and analyzed market date, internal job relationships and researched current trends to ensure pay levels and practices aligned with pay philosophy and competitive market. 
Benchmarked job positions and grade levels based on Hay Job Evaluation methodology. Harmonized grading structure across acquired and merged companies within the Air Products group.  
 
Responsible for Company Car benefit policy and all HR benefit related matters. 
 HR Manager Citigroup June 1994  –  May 1999  (5 years) London, United Kingdom HR Business Partner to the Corporate Finance group in Europe. Staffing, compensation, talent inventory, performance management, staff relations, employment law and policy, international mobility and graduate/MBA recruitment.

Summary For those reading this far, thank you for your interest as I am always open to opportunities to meet people and to engage in new challenges. I was born and raised in Brazil and have lived in the United States for the past 10 years. I am fluent in Portuguese, Spanish and English.  
 
Currently I am a Certified Administrator in the use of the Salesforce cloud platform. In addition I consult for Google evaluating the accuracy and quality of their online advertising. Prior to this I obtained a degree in Sound Engineering from Ex’pression College of Digital Arts in the Bay Area.  
 
My passion for music is fed by my interest in formulas and mathematical thinking; this in turn, has led me to find my place in both tech support and quality control. I rise to the challenge of helping people resolve complex computer problems with a minimal amount of emotional stress. I find that doing this work successfully draws upon my helpful nature, intellectual creativity and my scholastic training in systems logic.
